description.narrative: Output 4.2 :A clear structure and system in place to produce timely and predictable evidence on child protection needs and trends to inform emergency programming and advocacy initiatives, and support secure child protection case management

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.2 :A clear structure and system in place to produce timely and predictable evidence on child protection needs and trends to inform emergency programming and advocacy initiatives, and support secure child protection case management

description.narrative: A functional child protection information system is in place in some parts of Yemen, producing trends In 2019 UNICEF maintained a functional child protection monitoring and reporting mechanism which produced trend analysis on grave child rights violations with verified and reliable data that effectively informed the SG Annual Report on CAAC, the Yemen Country Report and CTFTMR advocacy initiatives that included engaging parties to the conflict in discussions to stop the recruitment of children, stop the use of schools by militia, and end to the killing and maiming of children and the release of all children captured on the frontline. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/01/2020

title.narrative: # of trends analysis reports produced by the case management information system, used to inform programme response and advocacy
% of active cluster members who provide child protection information/data on monthly basis to UNICEF
% of incidents verified and documented from all reported incidents
